derivation: or (shortened) גִּחוֹן; from H1518 (גִּיחַ)lemma גּיחַ missing vowel, corrected to גִּיחַ; stream;
outline:
Gihon = "bursting forth"
  1. one of the four rivers of the Garden of Eden
  2. a spring near Jerusalem where the anointing and proclaiming of Solomon as king took place
strongs_def: Gichon, a river of Paradise; also a valley (or pool) near Jerusalem
